intro: Ceraia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ceraia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture. Ceraia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
